ovdesc.p: This application records common characteristics of Document Types, which is a second level of classification of Documents after Document Type.
This is an installation level application shared by all Companies and records of this application could not be reversed.

desc.p: Specifies the Companies in which Documents of this Type needs to be tracked.

Example: For an LD contract, Document Type A is specified as a required Document Type in all Companies. However, if the Document Type A is restricted here to only Companies BNK and BN2, then Document A would be tracked, only when an LD contract is input from either Company BNK or BN2.
Validation Rule
Multi-value Optional field.
Must be a valid id of the table MNEMONIC.COMPANY.
A value of Null signifies that there is no Company dependent restriction for tracking documents of this type.
Specifes the version of the Document Type.
For information purposes only.
1-35 alpha numeric characters.
Optional.
Description of the Document Type.
Multi value language field.
Input mandatory.
1-35 Alpha numeric characters.
The date and frequency of review for the document type.
A combined date & frequency field which is automatically cycled by the system as part of the document type application's end-of-day.
10 type FQU (combined date & frequency code). (Optional input)
ID of the DOCUMENT.TYPE.
1-10 alpha characters.
Records of this application could not be reversed.
Specifies which of the fields STAUS.DATE or SIG.DATE would be used to calculate the validity for a Document of this type.
Validation Rule
Mandatory if the field VALID.PERIOD has a value.
Allowed values are STATUS.DATE or SIG.DATE.
Value
of SIG.DATE is allowed only if the value of the field SIGNATURE.REQD is Yes.
Specifies document type(s) which are considered as equivalent to this document type, in terms of purpose and processing.
If an equivalent document type exists with a valid status, it would be treated for the purposes of document tracking as if the main document type exists with a valid status.

Equivalence of document types would be checked at only one level. i.e. If Document Type A has an equivalent Document Type B and Document Type B has an equivalent Document Type C, when A is tracked only the existence of B with a valid status would be checked and any status of C would be ignored.
Must be the ID of a valid record in the file DOCUMENT.TYPE except ID of the current Document Type.
Not allowed for Contract specific documents (Field CONTACT.SPECIFIC is YES)
The desired period, prior to the expiry date of a document of this type, notices need to be sent to Customers, could be specified here.
For information purposes only.
Validation Rule
Optional input.
1-999 D (day), M (month) or Y (year) accepted.
Defines the date up to which the document type would be effective for tracking purposes.
Input optional.
Date entered should be greater than or equal to BEGIN. DATE.
Date entered should be greater than or equal to Bank Date.
Standard T24 date format.
Specifies the period up to which a Document of this type would be valid from the date specified in the field VALID.BASE.DATE.
The validity period could be specified either from the date specified in the field VALID.BASE.DATE or from its calendar year beginning.
If the status attached to a document of this type is invalid, then T24 would not calculate its expiry date, using the definition of this field.
Refer to the help text for the field END.DATE in the file CUST.DOCUMENT for calculation of expiry date using this field.
Example
VALID.PERIOD=Null, No End date would be calculated.
VALID.PERIOD= 12M, VALID.BASE.DATE=STATUS.DATE. For a document of this type with a STATUS.DATE of 20.2.2002, its End date would be calculated as 19.2.2003.

VALID.PERIOD= 12MS, VALID.BASE.DATE=STATUS.DATE - calculation to be done from year Beginning. For a document of this type with a STATUS.DATE of 20.2.2002, its End date would be calculated as 31.12.2002.
VALID.PERIOD= 12M, VALID.BASE.DATE=SIG.DATE. For a document of this type with a SIG.DATE of 19.2.2002, its End date would be calculated as 18.2.2003.
VALID.PERIOD= 12MS, VALID.BASE.DATE=SIG.DATE - calculation to done from year beginning. For a document of this type with a SIG.DATE of 19.2.2002, its End date would be calculated as 31.12.2002.
Validation Rule
Optional input.
Must be in the format xxxD, xxxM or xxxY to specify the number of days, months or years respectively from the VALID.BASE.DATE.
Must be in the format xxxDS, xxxMS or xxxYS to specify the number of days, months or years respectively from the VALD.BASE.DATE's calendar year beginning.
Specifies whether the document type (if required for Customer creation), needs to be tracked only for new Customers created on or after the BEGIN.DATE.
If the value of this field is YES:
Document type would be tracked for new customers created on or after the BEGIN.DATE, provided it is a required document type for them.

When an existing Customer is modified, and if this document type is a required one, it would be tracked (its Status would be tested for processing) only if it has been already tracked (record exists in the file CUST.DOCUMENT) for that Customer.
Optional input with allowed values YES/NO.
A Null value would be interpreted as NO.
YES not allowed if the field CONTRACT.SPECIFIC is YES.
YES not allowed when equivalent documents (Field: EQUIV.DOC) are specified.
This Document Type could be specified as a required document type only for a Customer document group.
Defines the date from which the document type would be tracked.
Mandatory.
Defaults to Bank Date.
Cannot be less than Bank Date.
Specifies the document class to which the document type belongs to.
Input Mandatory.
Must be ID of a valid record in the file DOCUMENT.CLASS.
Specifies whether a document of this type needs to be obtained separately for each contract (Transaction) from the customer.
Example: A Promissory Note might be obtained for each loan granted to a Customer.
Validation Rule
Input mandatory.
Allowed values YES/NO. Defaults to NO.
Once input and authorized can not be changed.
Both the fields NEW.ALL.CUST and CONTRACT.SPECIFIC cannot be YES.
If YES, the document type cannot be specified as a required document type for a Customer Document Group.

Allowed values NO/YES.
